item.description: I take many photographs each week. A church in the small Canadian village of Benson, Saskatchewan. My parents were married in this church.

item.description: A dock at my friend John Reeveâ€™s cabin at Lake Kachess.

item.description: 3 P-51 Mustangâ€™s that I captured at a recent event with the Flying Heritage Collection at Payne Field.

item.title: How To Make A Big Decision
item.description: Last summer our oldest daughter was married and I had the awesome responsibility of saying a few words at the wedding reception to the newly married bride and groom. I do a fair amount of speaking in my job as an Evangelist at Microsoft, but this was a very different talk. After a lot of thought (over months) on what to talk about, I came to the decision that I should relay one of the better pieces of advice that I have received.

item.title: Hummingbird In The Snow
item.description: It snowed again this morning at our home in Fall City, Washington. Iâ€™m not sure when this cruel joke of winter will be over here. I moved away from Saskatchewan to leave snow. Although to keep it in perspective, it hasnâ€™t really been cold. ğŸ™‚ Making up for it all was this amazing photo that my wife captured this morning. Great showÂ of a hummingbird braving the winter for a drink in our backyard.

item.title: Diners Drive-Ins and Dives in Las Vegas
item.description: Iâ€™m a major fan of the television program Diners Drive-Ins and Dives. This show with Guy Fieri goes across the United States popping into great places with good food. Here in Seattle Iâ€™ve eaten a few times at Voulaâ€™s Offshore Cafe which has been on the show. You have to eat their Greek Hobo. Iâ€™m actually on a secret mission (guess its not a secret now) to eat at all of the places that Guy Fieri frequents on his popular Food Network show.

item.title: Streaming Live With Scott Guthrie, Jeff Atwood and Twitter
item.description:
Once again for Mix, my team worked on what we call the live experience. Since PDC 2003, weâ€™ve been working on ways for the folks at home and those attending in person can make a connection to the event.
WithÂ this work weâ€™ve streamed the keynotes live, published breakout sessions for on demand viewing, filmed behind the scenes videos for Channel 9 along with some humorous ones and even overlaid Tweets tagged #MIX09 on top of the live keynote player on the web site and on the big screens in the keynote halll via our Flotzam screen saver.

item.title: My Daughter Was Banned From Club Penguin
item.description:
My 9 year old daughter is a major fan of Disneyâ€™s Club Penguin. She loves to go online in this virtual world, hanging out with her friends, updating her status and buying virtual items to trick out her igloo.
Photo Credit: Chaos1017 Josie was sad this week when she attempted to login to Club Penguin and was denied access. â€œA moderator has banned your account for 24 hoursâ€

item.title: Selectively Synchronizing Facebook and Twitter Status
item.description: One of my more popular blog posts is where I explain how to push your Facebook status to Twitter. When I wrote this, about two years ago, people were more likely to update their Facebook status than Twitter. My hack with TwitterFeed made it simple to push that status update to Twitter. Times have changed since then and I find myself updating my status to Twitter and wanting to be selective about what I update Facebook with my Twitter status.

item.title: Supporting Web Standards With Microsoft
item.description: Today, my team has released Oxite.Â Oxite is an open source, standards compliant, and highly extensible content management platform that can run anything from blogs to big web sites. We are releasing this as our second edition of the Mix Online web magazine that focusses on web standards.Â OxiteÂ began as a side project of Adam Kinney and Duncan Mackenzie and is a subset of the Channel 9Â source code. When it was time to do a reboot of the Mix OnlineÂ web siteÂ Duncan and his team created an experience where could release the source code (a popular customer request of Channel 9) that used ASP.

item.title: Watching Microsoft PDC From Home
item.description: I promised that I would be back. I am. It has been a very exciting time with Microsoft PDC week now here. One of the things that is new from my team is the PDC live event coverage. On the homepage of the PDC Website, you are able to watch the day 1 and 2 keynotes live. Weâ€™ve also superimposed recent activity from Twitter alongside the keynote stream. This is one of my favorite parts of the experience.

item.title: Bill Gates Transitions To The Foundation
item.description: This morning we posted a very special interview on Channel 9Â with Bill Gates.Â In this video interview, Charles Torre sits down with Bill Gates and they talk about everything from philantropy, the CSA role, competition with Google and platforms. I believe this will go down as one of our greatest Channel 9 interviews of all time and with a little over 1600 videosÂ produced to date, that is saying something.

item.title: The 4th Version of Channel 9 Is Now Live
item.description: Today we completed the deployment of Channel 9 Version 4.0. Weâ€™re still doing some final stabilization work that includes tweaking performance, but weâ€™re on our way. This is a 100 per cent rewrite of the predecessor and has been a long time in the making. A little over five years ago Channel 9 came on the air, some would say ushering in a wave of transparency for Microsoft and becoming a poster child for corporate blogging.

item.title: This Blog Is Now Running Graffiti by Telligent
item.description: For the past five and a half years, Iâ€™ve been running DasBlog. It has served me well over the years and Iâ€™m really appreciative of Chris Anderson for giving it a start with BlogX and finally to Clemens, Omar and Scott for moving it along as DasBlog. For quite some timeÂ I have wanted to make a move to something that had more extensibility, better themes and more of a self service admin.

item.title: Perspectives with Jon Udell
item.description: Jon Udell joined our team this past year.Â In a short period of time he has played a huge role in help shape the content and approaches we take in creating content for the Evangelism Network. (Better know as the network of communities including Channels 8, 9, 10, Mix Online and TechNet Edge. Today Jon is launching a new Microsoft-oriented interview series called Perspectives. The show covers a variety of topics including robotics, digital identity, e-science, and social software.

item.title: Hard Rock Cafe Memorabilia
item.description: Demo of the year for music fans. Not just a demo, going live this week.Hard Rock Cafe

item.title: MIX08 on Channels 9, 10 and Mix Online
item.description: So weâ€™re down here at MixÂ and what has now become a tradition my team is providing real-time coverage of the event via Channels 9, 10 and Mix Online. Weâ€™ll have something for everyone.Â All the cool demos and deep dives with the partners along with the keynote stream are on Mix Online. On Channel 9, for the hardcore Developers weâ€™ll have deep dives with the folks who build the product.

item.title: Channels 8 and 9 on Microsoft.com
Students Get Microsoft Software For Free!
item.description: Ok, this will hopefully go down as one of those announcements as, â€œMan, it is about time someone did this!â€.Â Tonight, over on Channel 8 Bill Gates is announcing Microsoft DreamSpark. With DreamSpark on Channel 8 students can download Visual Studio , Expression and Windows Server. These arenâ€™t limited editions or time bombed copies either, its the full meal deal. Today, DreamSpark we are going live in 10 countries, including Belgium, China, Finland, France, Germany, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, the U.

item.title: Last Chance to Join Our Team
item.description: Weâ€™ve had a number of new faces join the team in last few months. Max Zuckerman joined us to as Student Content Machine on Channel 8, Dan Fernandez is cranking with Channel 9 and Nic Fillingham is relocating from Singapore to work on Channel 10. Guess what?Â We have room for one more.Â Over on Duncanâ€™s team we have an opening.Â Come join the Microsoft team that works hard, plays hard and is changing how Microsoft connects with the community through social media.

item.title: Where the heck have I been?
item.description: Man, what a wild ride the last couple of months have been.Â As usual weâ€™re going full tilt, building out the code that drives the Evangelism Network and the content that keeps people coming back for more. ğŸ™‚Â It has been a while since Iâ€™ve blogged about whatâ€™s going on in my life and there has been plenty going on at work and at home.Â I figured Iâ€™d update you all about work, my life at home is pretty well documented thanks to Flickr and Facebook.

item.title: Dan Fernandez Joins Channel 9
item.description: We found our Yogi Bear. Dan Fernandez has joined our team and will be a new addition to the Channel 9 team, a new partner in crime for Commander Torre.Â Iâ€™ve known Dan for sometime and have always enjoyed working with him.Â One of the first things we did together was a Summer of Express contest on Channel 9 back in 2004. Danâ€™s definitely familiar with what we do (he was the 41st person to register on Channel 9), but will bring plenty of new ideas to the team.

item.title: Sammamish Plateau Mountain Bike Skills Park
item.description: An article in todayâ€™s Seattle Times, caught both both the eye of myself and my neighbor: After years of pushing for a mountain-bike â€œskills parkâ€ on the Sammamish Plateau, the Backcountry Bicycle Trails Club got a $150,000 boost from King County to move forward with its plans, county officials announced Wednesday. The club signed an agreement to work with the county on developing the 120-acre project at Duthie Hill Park, a swath of second-growth conifers and deciduous trees that is underused, county officials say.

item.title: Charles Fitzgerald's Last Day
item.description: Today was Charles Fitzgeraldâ€™s last day at Microsoft. He will be missed and it is a sad day for many of us at the company, to see him move on. I will miss his brutal honesty, book recommendations and never-ending support for the community work my team does with Channels 8,9, 10 and Edge. An anonymous commenter over on Mini, nailed it when they wrote the following about Charles: If you ever sat in any of his presentations at places like the Platform Strategy Review events, and talked with our top customers, he â€˜gotâ€™ them and they â€˜gotâ€™ him.

item.title: Channel 10 â€“ The Bill Gates on CES 2008 Interview
item.description: Our first of many interviews of CES [now live on Channel 10][1] or here on my blog, thanks to Silverlight. Speaking of Silverlight, I am really looking forward to what the [NBC Olympics coverage][2] will be like with Silverlight.  Awesome news.

item.title: Channel 10 CES Coverage Begins
item.description: Weâ€™re here at the Podtech Bloghaus watching the Bill Gates CES keynote unfold.Â It is the best seat in the house for CES. ğŸ™‚ I am here with my Channel 10 team who are covering the event for Microsoft.Â Weâ€™ve justÂ publishedÂ an interview from this morning with Bill GatesÂ and will have an a great video with Robbie Bach up momentarily. Weâ€™ll have plenty of content going live all through the week both about Microsoft and many other cool geeky things from across the industry.

item.title: The Spammers tried to take over my Wikis
item.description: A couple of years back I created a set of Wikis.Â The first was to help folks track resources for David Allenâ€™s Getting Things Done Methodology.Â The second was to help people find power outlets in airports. Over the years both of these sites have flourished in popularity.Â The AirPower wiki in particular has been written up in a variety of travel magazines and the Getting Things Done Tools list sees very regular updates.

item.title: Architectural Renderings of The High Streets
item.description: The High Streets is a new shopping center under construction a few miles south of our home.Â It will be located in the Issaquah Highlands and is scheduled for completion in the Fall of 2009.Â Once completed it will include a variety of retailers, an upscale grocer, restaurants, a hotel, health club, and a theater. Weâ€™re looking forward to it and wonâ€™t miss the trek from Fall City to Redmond.

item.title: Webkinz Overloaded
item.description: Merry Christmas everyone. I can imagine Webkinz broke all sorts of sales records for itself, today.Â As I was saying back in October:Mark my words, Webkinz will be one of the top toys this holiday seasons for kids ages 6 â€“ 13+. The site has been overloaded today, making it difficult and sometimes impossible login at times due to a large volume of traffic. Hereâ€™s a screenshot from the login page.

item.title: Headed to CES?
item.description: Let us know on the CES Wiki.Â See you in Vegas.

item.description: Yes Virgina there is a Santa Claus. Internet Explorer 8 will/passes that Acid 2 Test.Â Charles interviews the team on Channel 9 and more over on the Internet Explorer Team Blog. Â

item.title: Cool Wall With Adam Kinney
item.description: Check out the [Christmas CoolWall][1] on Channel 10

item.title: Marc Orchant
item.description: Today in Marcâ€™s passing my thoughts, prayers and a heavy heart go out to his family and close friends.Â I had the pleasure of meeting Marc Orchant a number of years back.Â We both shared a passion for Getting Things Done.Â Marc was an awesome writer and left behind a great online history through Download Squad, OfficeZealot and more recently Blognation.Â In moments like this I am often short on the right words to express grief and will turn to music.

item.title: Saskatchewan Roughriders Win the Grey Cup
item.description: Saskatchewan defeated Winnipeg 23-19 in the 95th Grey Cup.  It is a great day to be from Saskatchewan.Â I can already hear my American friends say, â€œHow cute! Canadian footballâ€. ğŸ™‚ Photo Credit: CBC Sports

item.title: Welcome to TechNet Edge
item.description: Welcome to TechNet Edge Just doing a quick test of embedding TechNet Edge videos in my blog via Silverlight.Â TechNet Edge is a new community for IT Pros and a sister site to Channels 8, 9, 10 and Mix Online. Weâ€™re still in the process of taking this site live and wonâ€™t be open officially for business until Monday morning. You can go over now and play as we stabilize though.

item.title: Testing Our Updated Media Player
item.description: Registration for Mixâ€™08 is now live.Â My team has been working literally around the clock moving Mix Online to the EvNet 4.0 Codebase.Â Iâ€™ve talked about EvNet 4.0 previously, in a nutshell this is a common set of code drives Channels 8,9, 10 , Mix Online and something new weâ€™re callingÂ TechNet Edge.Â EvNet 4.0 is lean, localizable and for the future.Â This post is mostly about testing our new â€œsharableâ€ Silverlight player than anything else.

item.title: Scene It for the XBox 360 arrives this Tuesday
item.description: Scene It for the XBox 360 is coming out on Tuesday.Â (11/06/07).Â This will be the first game that my wife will purchase for our console and actually play. ğŸ™‚Â At $60, it is a pretty good deal as you get both the trivia game and 4 custom controllers.Â

item.title: Show Us Your Home â€“ Episode 1
item.description: The first episode of our Channel 10 series called â€œShow us your homeâ€ is now online.Â I talked about this a little while back here. The goal of this series is take folks into the homes of a wide variety of geeks, both inside and outside of our company.Â The high order bit of course is not the home itself, but the use of technology.Â Think about it, Channel 9 brought you inside the halls of Microsoft, now Channel 10 will take you to their homes.

item.title: Twitter Error Messages
item.description:
I love it when software developers allow their sense of humor to bubble up.Â The Twitter folks do a good job of this in their error messages.
I do like the error messages my team is now now surfacing up for file not founds. ğŸ˜‰Â I wonder what else we could do.Â It is a subtle thing to remind folks that there are actual human beings writing software, not machines.

item.title: Windows Live Photo Gallery Now Supports Flickr
item.description:
Lots of news today going around the blogs about the addition of Flickr publishing to to the Windows Live Photo Gallery Beta.Â Check out LiveSide, I Started Something, The Microsoft PhotoBlog andÂ Windows Live Wire for their perspectives. I installed it this morning while riding in on the bus (got to love bus service with wireless Internet).Â After installing, this dialog box absolutely made my morning.
Why? Iâ€™ve been a Flickr user for a long time.

item.title: Follow Microsoft Channels 8,9,10 and Mix Online with Twitter
item.description: You can now receive notifications of new content on Channels 8, 9, 10 and Mix Online through Twitter.Â I just put the finishing touches on this little side project over lunch today.Â (Note to self, donâ€™t order the cajun lunch special again. :-)) Want to get started?Â Are you a Student? Follow Channel 8 Are you a Developer or Architect? Follow Channel 9 Are you a Power User? Follow Channel 10

item.title: Microsoft Employees Show Us Your Home!
item.description: Are you a power user?Â (wow, thatâ€™s an out of date Wikipedia page if Iâ€™ve ever seen one :-)) Anyhow, if you are a power user, please read on. A couple of nights ago Larry Larsen, Max Zuckerman and I got together to film some new content at my home for Channel 10.Â This will used for a new series where we go to the homes of fellow Microsoft employees and show the technology they use.

item.description: Are you a power user?Â (wow, thatâ€™s an out of date Wikipedia page if Iâ€™ve ever seen one :-)) Anyhow, if you are a power user, please read on. A couple of nights ago Larry Larsen, Max Zuckerman and I got together to film some new content at my home for Channel 10.Â This will used for a new series where we go to the homes of fellow Microsoft employees and show the technology they use.

item.title: Is Webkinz the next Facebook?
item.description: Iâ€™ve seen the question of, â€œWhatâ€™s the next network to go big after Facebook?â€Â Webkinz of course.Â Mark my words, Webkinz will be one of the top toys this holiday seasons for kids ages 6 â€“ 13+. A real conversation from last night at dinner between our daughters Josie (8 years old) and Brynn (21 years old).Â Brynn of course is part of the Facebook generationÂ (more here).Â Josie is part of an equal phenomena known as Webkinz World.

item.title: Jeff Sandquist on Channel 9
item.description: Yes me. ğŸ™‚Â Iâ€™ve been in a few team interviews with my team who create Channel 9, but for whatever reason Iâ€™ve never had the camera turned around on me. I prefer to be the â€œbehind the scenes guyâ€ managing the chaos. Last week though, Rory grabbed a camera and interviewed me for Channel 9.Â View this video over on Channel 9 <center> &nbsp; </center> This is one of the final interviews Rory did at Microsoft.

item.title: Looking for Yogi Bear
item.description: Iâ€™m hiringÂ and with that Iâ€™m spreading the word about the openÂ positions I have to a lot of folks.Â Today while describing the jobs, I got to talking about Robert Scoble.Â I often get asked about what Robert did best for Channel 9. There were a lot of things Robert did great for Microsoft especially outside of Channel 9 and I could go on for awhile for those things.

item.title: Really Achieving Your Childhood Dreams
item.description: If you watch one piece of media this year, please make it this one.Â It is about 90 minutes in length and is absolutely riveting.Â Iâ€™m actually listening to it again this morning as I work through email. Carnegie Mellon Professor Randy Pausch, who is dying from pancreatic cancer, gave his last lecture at the university Sept. 18, 2007, before â€¦ all Â» a packed McConomy Auditorium. In his moving talk, â€œReally Achieving Your Childhood Dreams,â€ Pausch talked about his lessons learned and gave advice to students on how to achieve their own career and personal goals.

item.title: Come Work At Microsoft In Evangelism!
item.description: Thereâ€™s only one team for me at Microsoft and that of course is Developer & Platform Evangelism.Â It is called DPE inside Microsoft.Â Within DPE lives my group that creates both technology and the content that drives Channels 8, 9 and 10.Â As a team weâ€™re on a mission to change how Microsoft does Evangelism and that is through the combination of social media and online community.Â We have a bunch of openings on our team.

item.title: Channel 9 Version 4.0 â€” Believe
item.description: View this video over on Channel 9 The video shown above in many ways accurately describes how my team has felt over the past year.  We signed up for a big mission, to go beyond just Channel 9 and deliver a network of online community focused on a wide variety of audiences.  It has been hard.   Sometimes we wondered if we’d win the war.  Today a small, but important victory.

item.title: Channel 9 Gets Silverlight
item.description: Yes Ryan Stewart, Adobe Evangelist ğŸ™‚ weâ€™ve fulfilled your dreams, Channel 9 now uses Silverlight for its media experience. ğŸ˜‰ Ryan Stewart writes: Also, when is Channel 9 going to support Silverlight so I donâ€™t have to load up Qucktime to watch it? See this video on Channel 9! Happy to have you as a faithful Channel 9 viewer, especially with all the Silverlight content as of late.

item.title: The Return From My Sabbatical
item.description: Iâ€™ve been back on the job for a little over three weeks, returning from my sabbatical from Microsoft.Â A lot of folks ask me what it is like to be back and wonder how it is going though.Â So I thought Iâ€™d write a few paragraphs here to explain. In many ways my return to my team reminds of a lot of a speeding locomotive.Â The locomotive is speeding down the tracks at over 100 miles per hour and I needed to get on.

item.title: The High Streets Mall
item.description: As mentioned previously in a post, thereâ€™s a new shopping center going in a few miles south of us.Â My neighbor Nancy, left a comment in my previous with a link to the website for the development.Â The shopping center is being called The High Streets.Â The developer is Real Retail and theyâ€™ve behind some nice projects in the Puget Sound like Pacific Place, Kent StationÂ and University Village.

item.title: Office Makeover
item.description: I arrived at work today and found my office received a bit of a makeover. More photos . Photo credit: Volker Will

item.title: Issaquah Highlands Mall
item.description: It appears that we are getting a new mall, about four miles directly south from us on the Issaquah Highlands.Â The Issaquah Highlands Undressed and Issaquah Undressed blogs are reporting thatÂ construction has begun on a new mall for the area. I havenâ€™t been able to find many details online, but the undressed sites say that the mall will rival Bellevue SquareÂ / Redmond Town Center in size.Â If you have more information on the project, please drop me a line via the comments on the blog so I can keep this post up to date with the latest news.

item.title: Returning to Microsoft from Sabbatical
item.description: It seems just like yesterday that I was headed off on my sabbatical from Microsoft.Â This has been a break chalked full of memories that I will have for a lifetime.Â As I prepare for the burn of reentry, I thought it would be useful to pen some random thoughts about my break.Â There have been so many highlights.Â The massive road trip that Josie and I took, making peace with my past, getting involved with the Skate Like A Girl non-profit, laser eye surgery spending time with my wonderful wife LauriÂ ,Â hanging with our cool dog BradyÂ and getting to know my neighbors.

item.title: Childhood Ingenuity Bubblewrap
item.description: Kids are smart. Check out a fun little game that Josie and her neighborhood friends came up with today.Â Living in a new neighborhood means lots of people unpacking.Â With unpacking you have a lot of bubble wrap on hand. For great fun, all you need is a Razor Scooter, a fresh roll of bubble wrap and your friends. Video: Bubbles Popping Razor Scooters Arenâ€™t kids great? Do try this at home.

item.title: The Family Home on Holmgren Bay is sold
item.description: The place that I grew up at on Holmgren Bay in Estevan, Saskatchewan has now been sold.Â Estevan, an area rich is natural resources, is booming right now.Â There is a lack of housing now so the sale was very quick. Mom and Dad will be moving out to condo life on the west coat of Canada taking new roots in Kelowna, B.C.Â For Mom and Dad this will mean a warmer climate, the end of yard maintenance and a much shorter trip to visit us down in Fall City, Washington.

item.title: Teamwork with Skateboarding
item.description: This photo will go down as one of my favorites from an amazing summer break.Â Josie and I went out yesterday with a bunch of folks from Skate Like A Girl to the Skatebarn in Renton.Â Skatebarn is an amazing facility with over 45,000 square feet of ramping goodness.Â Extra bonus is that on Wednesdays its free for girls. The half pipe was to tall for Josie to get to the top.

item.title: How to publish your Facebook status to Twitter
item.description: With the addition of public facing feeds to Facebook I am now able to publish my status on Facebook to Twitter.Â Hereâ€™s how you can do it also. First, find your status RSS feed on Facebook.Â It is buried.Â (Thanks Bizzle!Â for helping me find mine.)Â To find it, you need to visit your profile on Facebook and on your mini-feed select “See All”.Â On the right you will see a list of items, select â€œstatus storiesâ€ and finally below this a feed link can be found.

item.title: Amazon to open grocery service? Amazon Fresh
item.description: Is Amazon opening up a grocery service?Â I spotted this interesting truck today in Bellevue, Washington.Â I sure hope they are opening a grocery service.Â Our family loved the now defunct HomeGrocer.com service from the late 90s.Â We were “beta testers” and used it as our only grocery service for quite some time. The services Safeway and Albertsons have opened just donâ€™t compare to what was Home Grocer. Anyone have a link to Amazon Fresh or a beta invite?

item.title: Flickr Wallpaper Rotator
item.description: Check out Rush Frisbyâ€™sÂ Flickr Wallpaper Rotator application, written usingÂ .NET Framework 2.0 This tray application cycles through your desktop background to a photo from Flickr.Â You can specify tags, user names with how often you want the background image to change. I have mine set to feature pictures from the Flickr colorful tag every couple of hours. Cool. Edited: Updated ro fix broken link (01/02/08)

item.title: Life is good
item.description: I am feeling great, rested and healthy.Â Although I am still recovering from the Custom PRK Laser Eye surgery, every day my vision is improving.Â In the mornings I can see well enough to use a computer, but by evening that is an impossibility. I hope you are having a great summer too.

item.title: Microsoft On Facebook: 17,802 Strong
item.description: Over on WinBeta they are writing: Microsoft has a giant presence on Facebook, with over 17,000 employees (out of 70,000 worldwide) joining their Facebook network. Since you need a Microsoft email address to get it, itâ€™s highly unlikely these are anything but real Microsofties, and the large number means Facebook is becoming a pretty important means of communication inside MS. Youâ€™ll be able to find the real profile of Bill Gates in there, and discover that he has only 57 friends, while Ray Ozzie has 105 friends, including Mike Arrington, Steve Ballmer, Don Box, Joanne Bradford, Steve Case, Steve Chen, Anil Dash, Gary Flake, Steven Levy of Newsweek, Dare Obasanjo, Jeff Sandquist, Robert Scoble, and Mark Zuckerberg.

item.title: Skate Like a Girl Camp in Kirkland, WA
item.description:
Skate Like a Girl will be partnering with Kirkland Teen Union Building for the second summer to present two week long skateboard camps for girls.Â One for older teens will be held July 30 throughÂ August 3, 10am â€“ 4pm).Â Then August 6-10 a camp for younger girls will take place. Sign up your daughters now!
In order to register you must first create an account with the City of Kirkland, and then you can register for the camps.

item.title: Every Car You Chase â€“ The Police mashed with Snow Patrol
item.description: I been listening to a lot of music over the break.Â 80s Canadian Rock, New Country,Â Beatles and The Police.Â An accidental discover though was a mash up between The Police and Snow Patrol.Â Check out Every Car You ChaseÂ by Party Ben.Â Really cool. listen

item.title: Skateboarders are Athletes
item.description: Imagine if we treated all athletes like we do skateboardersâ€¦.. Photo taken outside of Washington Mutual in Sammamish, WA

item.title: Saying Goodbye to George Symons
item.description: An old family friend, George Symons has passed away.Â In many ways Geroge was like a grand father and his entire family was a big part of my family. Many folks back in Estevan believe I am related to the Symons Family.Â Weâ€™re not, at least not by blood.Â In fact some of the best family are the ones you choose. I got toÂ know George and family whenÂ my mother went to work for them running their grocery wholesale business back in the 80â€™s.

item.title: Recovering from PRK Laser Eye Surgery
item.description: I havenâ€™t updated this blog with my recovery progress since having PRK. PRK is a laser eye procedure different than Lasik.Â PRKÂ has a much longer recovery time.Â The goal of both Lasik and PRK is the same, which is to enable people to see without glasses.Â I had wavefront guided custom PRK. For the first few days with PRK there was a great deal of discomfort and it has taken about a week to regain semi-functional vision without the use of eyeglasses.

item.title: PRK Laser Eye Surgery Today
item.description: Today is the day for my PRK Laser Eye Surgery. From reading the forums on USA Eyes, it sounds like I am not going to want to be on the computer for a number of days due to vision fuzziness.Â I also wonâ€™t have the ability to drive for a number of days. Iâ€™ve loaded up an MP3 player with audio books and music to help pass the time. Iâ€™ll post updates on how the surgery has gone as my new vision allows.

item.title: 7-11 Kwik-E-Mart: Cool Cross Product Promotion
item.description: Last night, in Seattle I was able to see one of the coolest cross product promotions ever.Â In order to promote The Simpsons Movie, 20th Century Fox has partnered with 7-11 to make over select 7-11 Stores as Kwik-E-Marts.Â Kwik-E-Mart, of course is the local convenience store from The Simpsons television series. Stores in twelve cities in Canada and the United States have received the make over.Â In addition to changing the signage they have launched new products too.

item.title: Surgery on Thursday
item.description: Lasik surgery that is. For over 25 years Iâ€™ve worn glasses.Â Without my glasses I am useless.Â Iâ€™ve tried contact lenses but have had problems with getting them in my eyes. Thursday though, hopefully will be the end of my relationship with eyeglasses.Â I am going in for Lasik surgery.Â Technically it is not Lasik that I am getting.Â Due to some anomalies with my eyes I will need to have PRK (Photorefractive Keratectomy) instead.

item.title: New Header Graphics
item.description: Michael Giles created a few new headers for my blog to honor my vacation.Â I added a random imageÂ script to my Dasblog installation to cycle through them, showing a new one each time a page is refreshed. item.description: Josie has been asking to cut her hair for a while now â€“ finally Lauri relented after one too many tangles and a few too many arguments. Weâ€™ve heard of Locks of Love and we were explaining to Josie how long its taken to grow her hair from super-short to just at her bum (2 solid years) and she really didnâ€™t care. Ah well, itâ€™s just hair, right? ğŸ™‚ So, with one cut, Josie lost nearly 12 inches of hair and then Lauri spent another 15 minutes evening it all up and she has a cute new summer â€˜do.

item.title: Josie and I are Home from our trip
item.description: After a little over 2900 miles, 3 provinces, four states and after two weeks on the road Josie and I are back home from our trip.Â Plenty of photos can be found on Flickr.Â It was an awesome adventure.Â Thank you Janice, Yarek, Lynda and Mom and Dad for the places to stay.Â To all the old friends. thanks for giving Josie and I so much to do.Â Weâ€™ll be talking about this trip for years.

item.title: Canadian Crop Circle Research Museum
item.description: Yes you can in Estevan. ğŸ™‚Â Estevan is now home to the Canadian Crop Circle Research Museum.

item.title: Wired Fiction is DÃ©jÃ vu
item.description: Another article up from Fred on Wired.com.Â SeemsÂ the opening of the article is a little bit of fiction to tee up some drama.Â From, â€œTechCrunch Blogger Michael Arrington Can Generate Buzz â€¦ and Cashâ€ â€œMichael Arrington was sound asleep in his bedroom in Atherton, California, when three men burst in. Naturally, he was startled. His first reaction, he recalls, was to tell them to â€œget the fuck out.â€ But he quickly realized they meant no harm.

item.title: Goodbye to Sam The Record Man
item.description: I was about to write a post about re-discovering my album and cd collection in my parentâ€™s basement and I just heard that Sam the Record Man will be closing the doors to its famous YongeÂ Street location in Toronto, Ontario. It wasnâ€™t long ago that Sam The Record Man was Canadaâ€™s largest music retailer with 130 stores Canada wide.Â Now only three locations will remain. Sam The Record Man was the store where I purchased my very first album, Kiss Alive II.

item.title: Flight over Southern Saskatchewan
item.description: It continues to be quite a busy and fun trip up to in Estevan, Saskatchewan.Â On Monday my Dad, my Uncle Dale and I chartered a small plane to take a tour over the local area. Things sure look different from above.Â We saw theÂ Alameda Reservoir/Dam, the Shand Power Generation Plant, Estevan Comprehensive High SchoolÂ and a number of other places. My favorite view of all was Benson, Saskatchewan.Â This is the small town of about one hundred people where I grew up.

item.title: I'm getting a lot of sun :-)
Estevan, Hot Spot in Canada
item.description: The last few days, Estevan (where Josie and I are currently staying) has been the hot spot temperature wise for all of Canada.Â The temperatures have been around 32.2 degrees Celsius. Kevin Armstrong and I took our girls out on Boundary Reservoir for a day of boating.Â Kevin recently purchased an eighteen footÂ Sea RayÂ and we had a great afternoon out on it.Â We went cruising, tubing and swimming.Â The water in Boundary Reservoir is nice and warm.

item.title: The Tower Cafe has the best pizza on the Planet
item.description: I had the best pizza on the planet today at the Tower CafeÂ in Estevan, Saskatchewan.Â I think I eat two of these pizzas (not in the same evening) whenever I come and visit.Â TodayÂ it was at lunch with two old friends, Kevin Toombs and Kim Empey.Â Our pizza was the Tower Special which has mushrooms, pepperonis, ham, green peppers, and pineapple on it.Â The sauce is a little spicy and there is plenty of cheese.

item.title: Nothing Compares to a Saskatchewan Sunset
item.description:
You canâ€™t beat Saskatchewan sunsets!
I took this last night as we were coming in from an evening of fishing on Rafferty Dam.Â Really nice evening, 90+ degrees outside and the water was smooth as glass. More photos [over on my Flickr site][3].  It has been a lot of fun hanging out with old friends here in Estevan.  I think we’ll stay for awhile.

item.title: Canadian / American Tour Update
item.description: Josie and I have been on the road since Sunday morning for our big trip.Â We decided to delay our departure by a day so we could pack, get the windshield repaired on my car and make sure weâ€™re rested up. It has been a wonderful trip.Â We have put on almost 1300 miles so far and have put a few photos up on our Flickr set in the process of getting here.

item.title: and so it begins..
item.description: Time to decompress, pack and begin the trip.Â More interesting stuff (to some :-)) soon.Â

item.title: Humming Bird In Our Backyard
item.description: Friday morning, around 7 am, Lauri noticed a little hummingbird in our backyard, trying to get something out of the globe lights around our umbrella. Interesting. Around 7 am this morning, the hummingbird was back, only this time it was sticking its long beak into the orange bell shaped blossoms on our Thompson Maple tree that we had planted when my folks were in town. She had looked up online what to put in the feeders, and boiled some water, let it cool down and added the sugar.

item.title: Five Years of change at Microsoft
item.description: Think you can predict the future of tech? ğŸ™‚Â Check out this post by Jon Udell from almost 5 years ago: Duncan Wilcox ruminates on how blogs can help implement the communication strategies outlined in the Cluetrain manifesto: Of course itâ€™s not as if starting a weblog automatically opens a corporation up to conversations, but itâ€™s a good start. For example reading Ray Ozzieâ€™s weblog has made me very interested in Groove (the product) and generally makes me feel good about Groove (the company) ï¿½ in long term that would make me trust both.

item.title: Summer Vacation â€“ a "do over"
item.description: This year Iâ€™ll celebrate eleven years at Microsoft. In September of 1996 I maxed out a credit card to relocate from Estevan, Saskatchewan to Redmond, Washington joining up with Microsoft as a contractor.Â As a contractor I didnâ€™t qualify for relocation benefits, but I figured it was a worthy risk :-).Â My first jobÂ was to support the beta of Active Server PagesÂ along withÂ Internet Studio.Â Later on I made the transition to full-time employee status, supporting the released editions of these new Internet products.

item.title: Inch by inch to Channel 9 Version 4.0
item.description: Robert Scoble in a post about ZoomrÂ made a reference to my motto of inch by inch.Â This phrase has been a part of my vocabularyÂ since the summerÂ of 2002, after seeing a Microsoft internal parodyÂ video of Al Pacinoâ€™s speech from Any Given Sunday.Â When success with a certain problem/project seems insurmountable it makes sense to retreat to a shorter term goal.Â Once you make that goal, move onto the next and eventually you will make that touchdown.

item.title: My Day As a Race Driver
item.description: As mentioned previously, my wife gave me a day of Performance Driving Training as an early birthday gift.Â On Tuesday this week I spent the day at Pacific Raceways road course in a class led by Don Kitch.Â The driving would be done my in my own car, a Corvette. The day began at 8:00 am sharp (after signing off on a lengthy liability waiver) with an in class presentation by Don.

item.title: Proformance Training
item.description: It will be an extended long weekend for me.Â My Mom and Dad came into town and on Tuesday, Iâ€™ll be having my birthday presentÂ down at Pacific Raceway. It has been a great weekend with the folks.Â You see my Dad has had quite the battle with Cancer and is recharging from several recent surgeries.Â You know how they say, â€œWhen it rains, it pours ?â€Â In our family it has been aÂ total moonsoon on the family health front.

item.title: Hiding our hot tub
item.description: We have a hot tub that I use very regularly.Â I have rheumatoid arthritis and the hot tub really helps me sleep at night.Â It is definitely a keeper. ğŸ™‚ To be honest though I donâ€™t like the look of it on our patio.Â My wife and I have begun to think through the plans for our new backyard and have been trying to decide what to do with the hot tub.

item.title: ScrewTurn Wiki Version 2.06
item.description: Iâ€™ve been looking for some wiki code for a side project.Â I had looked at MediaWiki (didnâ€™t really want to do PHP) and was happy to find ScrewTurn WikiÂ today. Interesting, definitely looks a lot more feature rich than Flexwiki.

item.title: Channels 9 + 10 at the CEO Summit
item.description: I watched the CEO Summit live on the web this year.Â It is cool that they streamed Billâ€™s keynote and you can watch it now on demand.Â My favorite part was the following sectionÂ about 10 minutes in:The last thing here I wanted to mention is that with video arriving on the Internet, itâ€™s possible for a company to create essentially their own TV channel. And itâ€™s actually better than a TV channel in that people can come in and watch at any time video on demand.

item.description: Iâ€™ve played with Gallery Player a bit in the past via a Media Center PC.Â Amazing photographs, stunning visuals and lots of variety in content.Â I didnâ€™t keep using the product though and had forgotten about the company. item.description: I still eat Ramen Noodles.Â It drives my wife crazy and I can probably do without all the sodium, but they are so quick and easy.Â Perfect â€œguy snack foodâ€.Â I boil them, drain most of the water and add the flavour package as seasoning.Â When I want to go â€œupscaleâ€ I visitÂ the official ramen noodle blog and grab a recipe.Â There is also a book Iâ€™ve been meaning to add to our cook book collection, 101 Ways to Eat Ramen Noodles.

item.description: One of my favorite movies in the 80s was Wall Street.Â In fact one of my best friends Kevin Armstrong and I, with great pride would recite the famous, â€œGreed is Good Speechâ€ on demand.Â We were in high school and it was a fun parlor trick for social studies class.Â Kevin learnt it from watching the movie on VHS over and over.Â I was a closet geek and used Cinemania on my multimedia PC.

item.title: Publishing Lots of Video Content at an Event with Mix
item.description: One of the more insane things that my team has done lately (we have a list and we track these things you know ğŸ˜› ) was the content production we did for Mix.Â While at Mix we conducted about fifty interviews with Microsoft partners, event attendees and product team folks.Â For the first two and half days of the event Rory was doing non-stop interviews, Laura coordinated all the edits, Joshua drove the publishing process and Sampy ensured all was well on the homefront.

item.description: People definitely have gotten a better idea of what the folks behind software at Microsoft are like with our bloggers and Channels 9 + 10.Â Transparency has helped change how many perceive our company and at the very least has made the last 3 years of my life a lot more interesting. ğŸ™‚ Awhile back when looking for bloggers outside of the tech business I came across Trench Doc.Â Trench Doc is written by a Doctor who works the emergency room at a â€œSouthern Regional Medical Meccaâ€.

item.title: FeedBurner Move Complete
item.description: It worked. ğŸ™‚ The move to FeedBurner should be complete.Â Note to folks who plan on doingÂ this with Dasblog.Â The configuration page in Dasblog asks for your FeedBurner username.Â It doesnâ€™t really want that. My username for FeedBurner is JeffSand, but my feed is http://feeds.feedburner.com/jeffsandquist, so on the configuration page for DasBlog I had to specify JeffSandquist, not JeffSand. I think if you make this mistake you potentially could lose subscribers if their aggregator gets an incorrect 302 message from DasBlog.

item.title: Moving my Blog Feed to Feedburner
item.description: Iâ€™m moving the RSS feed for this blog to Feedburner.Â Omar and ScottÂ Â made the switch quite some time ago and from reading their blogs they are happy with it.Â For most of you, no action should be required as Dasblog 1.9 will automatically redirect your RSS Aggregator to my new feed. I like the idea of off-loading bandwith and the improved statistics that come with Feedburner.Â There areÂ some risks in outsourcing syndication.

item.title: Saturday Night Burgers and Fries
item.description: I love to cook.Â There is nothing more relaxing and stress relieving for me than finding a recipe, following the steps, maybe improvising a bit and tasting the final results. ğŸ™‚Â Over the years weâ€™ve assembled quite a cookbook collection in our home.Â Some of my favorites are from way back in the past.Â Whatâ€™s cool about the older cookbooks that we have is that they are handwritten.Â Many were created for family reunions, anniversaries and homecomings with family members submitting their recipes.

item.description: I just completed the upgrade of my T-Mobile Dash to Windows Mobile 6.0.Â You can grab the upgrade yourself from the T-Mobile site.Â Chris Ziegler at Engadget has a great overviewÂ of what you can expect from the upgrade. item.description: While I was down in Vegas with Mix, my wife sent me a message telling me that she had purchased my birthday present.Â My birthday is a little over a month away so she was going to have some fun teasing me.Â Iâ€™m really good at guessing these things, so ever since Iâ€™ve return from Vegas I have been playing 20 questions with her.Â I didnâ€™t come close to guessing.

item.title: Wired Magazine Article on Channel 9
item.description: It was last fall that Chris AndersonÂ invited me over to Wired Magazine for lunch â€œCondÃ© Nast Styleâ€ (they have a private chef) and it was all pretty cool.Â Chris gave me a personal tour of the facilities and told me all sorts of stories behind the history of Wired Magazine.Â I would be lying if I didnâ€™t say that this was a bit of a thrill for me.Â In the tour I saw where Apache Server was coded, a wall crowned with every cover of the magazine and a view of their future through the new www.

item.title: My Dad is fine
item.description: Quick update: Dad got a bed after waiting in emergency for about 24 hours and is now recovering.Â He did ultimately lose the bed about 24 hours after his surgery was finished, mom drove him back to Estevan and he was admitted into the local hospital.Â Heâ€™s resting and doing fine. Â Â

item.title: Health Care in Canada Versus United States
item.description: I am originally from Canada spending most of my youth in Saskatchewan.Â Saskatchewan was one of the first places in the world to create socialized medicine through a system known as medicare.Â This was later adopted by the entire country.Â I grew up withÂ socialized medicine as the norm and now live in a country without.Â It is with great interest that I watch the candidates line up for the next presidential election discussing the possibilities of free health care for all.

item.title: In The New Place
item.description: It will be a light posting on my blog this week as Iâ€™m taking the week off to get settled in our new home.Â There is a much longer post coming up soon on what I did learn through this around contingencies, selling your home in general and what a difference a great real estate agent can make.Â This is definitely an industry that needs technology.Â The whole process quite complicated and delivered stress at a level Iâ€™ve never encounteredÂ before.

item.title: Michael Garternberg Joins Microsoft
item.description: Just a quick note this morning to confirm that Michael Gartenberg [is joining Microsoft as an Enthusiast Evangelist][1]. After working as an industry analyst for more than decade, Iâ€™m leaving JupiterResearch to join Microsoft as an enthusiast evangelist. What is an enthusiast evangelist? Our job is to find, engage and work with enthusiasts and other influencers and show them all the cool stuff that Microsoft is doing. In short, itâ€™s our job to act as the bridge between Microsoft and end users.

item.title: Pandora Tray Application

item.title: GE Smart ConnectionCenter
item.description: Our new home has a very cool panel in the master bedroom closet.Â The panel is made by General Electric and is called the GE Smart ConnectionCenter.Â This unit brings everything from coaxial cable, home networking and telephone into a central point.Â From there it redistributes it to all the rooms in the rest of the home.Â Every room has multiple networking drops and coaxial cable.Â A nice touch in the panel is the video amplifierÂ which should help minimize signal loss when the coaxial cables are split in th panel.

item.description: Ok, my wife is sleeping right now and I am sitting here in Delhi and whatâ€™s running through my mind is when my wife will hear the news about the terrorist plot beingÂ thwarted in London.Â Charles, Laura and I are watching the BBC news here in Delhi and are pretty freaked out.Â The way we understand it now is that certain American airlines like United, Continental and American were targetted by terrorists.

item.title: Calacanis on one hit wonders
item.description: I think anyone who has completed a sucessful projects always wonder if their next one will meet the mark.Â I remember when we were weeks away from launching Channel 9 Lenn Pryor and I were down in the parking garage of building 119 at Microsoft.Â We were having a stress smoke and walking, wondering if we were actually creating something cool.Â We wondered if our previous hits were our lasts.Â I can relate a lot to this post.

item.title: Windows Live Messenger To Call Home

item.title: The 10 Commandments of Email
item.description: [][1] Along with the 5 Temptations of a CEO, the 10 Commandments of Email is another great read.Â Donâ€™t use your in-box as a catchall folder for everything you need to work on. Read items once, and answer them immediately if necessary, delete them if possible, or move them to project-specific folders. Set up a â€œFive Weeks Folderâ€ that deletes its content automatically after five weeks. Use it as a repository for messages youâ€™re unsure about, such as that email you want to delete, but youâ€™re not sure if the guyâ€™s going to call you tomorrow and ask about it.

item.title: 7 Day Software on 10
item.description: Back in 2004 I wrote about how if a piece of software is good enough for seven days, Iâ€™ll buy it.Â Since then a number of other bloggers have picked this up as way to talk about good, quality software and services. item.title: Software as a service

I see it in the .NET framework support for web services and ClickOnce, in Indigoâ€™sÂ attempts to unify the various Windows communications approaches into a simple, common services-based API, inÂ Avalonâ€™s borrowing of UI patterns (deployment, inductive UI, markup, navigation) from the Web.

item.title: September 11: Bearing Witness to History
item.description: From January 30 â€“ April 24, 2005 there will be a 9/11 display at the Washington State Museum of History. This is a travelling exhibit created by the Smithsonian Institute. September 11: Bearing Witness to History brings together objects, images and personal stories that help recall this historic day and its impact on our nation. Photographs and moving images capture moments from the attack, and visitors confront powerful artifacts including twisted steel from the World Trade Center, damaged items from the Pentagon, memorials from the crash site in Pennsylvania, clothing worn by survivors, and objects used by rescue workers and public officials.

item.title: Tivo like rewind and fast forward come to XM Radio
item.description: From [XM 411][1]: The space at the top right now has three buttons; PAUSE, BACK and FORWARD. These are what control the 30 minute replay feature. The SKYFi2 constantly records the last 30 minutes of whatever you listened to, regardless of your changing the channel. One thing to note is that this 30 minute memory gets wiped out every time the unit is turned off. Pressing the BACK button will take you back one event (song change) at a time.

item.title: Thanks Giving with the Parents
item.description: My parents were in town this week and in honour of their arrival we celebrated an early and also a belated Thanksgiving Dinner.  I missed Canadian Thanksgiving Dinner up at my parents house and will be away for the upcoming American one.  One of the advantages of being a Canadian married to an American is that we celebrate both the American and Canadian dates.   The week has been great!   I’ve been getting caught up on sleep and of course my gaming.

item.title: It sure is good to be back home again
item.description: PDCÂ is over and its great to be back home.Â Man, it feels just like yesterday that we were down in LA checking out the venue, visiting Universal and doing hotelÂ visits.Â In addition to being one of those guys helping with some of the logistics for the event I was part of a team of people amping community around the PDC.Â This included the PDC 2003 Community Environment (yes, we know lousy name).

item.title: Mural Update
item.description: Came home tonight around 9:00 PM and Jodie had been here painting.  She is very meticulous, just look at the details as she paints in the stonework.   I removed the white handrail shown in my [previous entry][1] from the wall to the right of the stairs as well.  No sense in having Jodie’s amazing work blocked by an unsightly handrail.   We plan to replace it with a wrought iron piece on the opposite wall.

item.title: I'm Blogging This T-Shirts
item.description: Glad to see you like the t-shirt and yes you are most defiinitely Welcome.Â One thing I should mention is that I am not the only person behind these t-shirts.Â These are compliments of the entire Longhorn Evangelism team.Â I was thinking the other day what would be very cool is to see photos of the t-shirts at unique landmarks as you all make your way to the PDC.We’ll definitely need to try and do a group photo, maybe Wednesday night at Universal Studios?

item.title: Roxio to acquire PressPlay

item.title: Blooming in Seattle
item.description: I love how my plants are turning out this year.Â One of the nice things about Seattleâ€™s winter of rain and gloom is that you appreciate the summer weather.Â I need to work on my plant selection though, when I picked the plants for my landscaping I didnâ€™t get enough variety.Â Once my RhododenreonsÂ loose their flowers my backyard loses some of its shine.So can someone recommend plantings that will get me blooms from now until September?
